title: Police Logs at Northwestern University (IL) Football Games in 2023

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any/all police logs related to incidents at football games for the Northwestern Wildcats during the 2023 season. 
Calls to service or arrests made at football games in the 2023 season.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

title: Boston Police Department Internal Affairs Compliment and Complaint

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Boston Police Department Internal Affairs Compliment and Complaints filed for the year 2018. Specifically, we request an extract of the records to include the following columns:
- Incident number
- Officer name
- Officer City of Boston ID (6-digits)
- Report narrative

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rachel Young

title: ALPR datasharing information - Whittier CA Police Dept

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: ALPR datasharing information - Whittier CA Police Dept
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

 Information related to Automated License Plate Reader (ALPR) data sharing. 1) The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data; 2) The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data; 3) The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information; 4) The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information;

*Records obtained from other agencies show the Whittier Police Department shares ALPR data with other agencies through Vigilant Solutions.  IF WPD is still a Vigilant Solutions customer, that program is capable of easily producing a report with the requested information.  

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Greg Buhl

title: Whittier Misconduct Disclosures to LA District Attorney

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Whittier Misconduct Disclosures to LA District Attorney
communications.communication:
Dear Whittier Police Department,

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act I am requesting the following records:

-A copy of the Whittier PD’s response(s) to Los Angeles District Attorney Gascon’s 2021 request related to officer misconduct infromation.  The request made individually to all law enformecent agenies in Los Angeles County is described in this article, www.latimes.com/california/story/2021-06-20/few-la-police-agencies-have-given-gascon-dishonest-cop-names

I am requesting any letter or email sent in reply ans well as any data transmitted. 
I would imagine most of such data should be covered by SB 1421. This request is for the data as it was produced to the LA District Attorney, with any redactions required by SB 1421.  

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter in the time frame set out in the CPRA.
Greg Buhl

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Whittier Police Department Pursuit, Crash, Injury, and Fatality Statistics (CHP)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act I am requesting copies of the following records:

-All pursuit, crash, injury, and fatality statistics the CHP maintains on the Whittier Police Department. If these are available online somewhere, pointing that url out to me would be sufficient. All I can find online is references to CHP maintaining such statistic, but not the the actual data. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter in the time frame set out in the CPRA. This request is being made in the public interest. The information is not being requested for any commercial purpose and will be made freely available to journalists.

Greg Buhl

title: Use of Force with GBI reports - Whittier CA Police Dept

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Use of Force with GBI reports - Whittier CA Police Dept
communications.communication:
Hello:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any reports, interviews, or similar investigative material in the department’s possession related to investigated Use of Force incidents involving WPD officers that caused Great Bodily Injury as defined by the state legislature (Injuries requiring 10 or more sutures and/or staples, Broken bones, All head injuries, Any injury deemed as serious. “Serious bodily injury” means injuries that involve a substantial risk of death, unconsciousness, protracted and obvious disfigurement, or protracted loss or impairment of the function of a bodily member or organ.)  Apologies if you already have this information posted to your website to comply with SB 1421 but I do not seem to be able to find it posted. 


Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

title: Civil Asset Forfeitture - Whittier CA Police Dept

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Civil Asset Forfeitture - Whittier CA Police Dept
communications.communication:
Hello,

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act I am requesting the following records:

-Any accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts and seizures made by the WPD, as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the WPD receives a share under the MOUs the department have in place with numerous agencies describing how assets are to be divided.

-Any annual reports produced on the WPD civil asset forfeiture program.

-Documents showing the balance of any funds currently in the WPD Civil Asset Forfeiture fund.

-A list of all items seized through civil asset forfeiture and retained for use by the WPD.

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases.

The time period for this request is for the last 10 years.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter in the time frame set out in the CPRA.

Greg Buhl
Lead Researcher at CheckLBPD.org

Chicago Park District (the “Park District”) responds to all public records requests by the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.  Please expect a response by Wednesday March 27, 2024 by close of business. Kind regards,

Karen Choudhury

title: Securities Statistics

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Securities Statistics
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any summary statistics or reports available on Russian securities (stocks, ADRs, bonds, EFTs and mutual funds) traded on US exchanges before Russian sanctions began in February 2022.  Please include: 1. Market value of securities before sanctions  2. Market losses following sanctions  3. Percentage of these securities owned by politically connected persons in the Russia Federation  4. Percentage of securities owned by Russian citizens vs. US citizens vs. third country citizens  5. Value, dates and ownership of very large sales of Russian securities during February 2022  6. Statistics on the dates and value of short sales and options trades during February 2022  7. Estimated percent of total Russian security value traded on US exchanges before sanctions

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sherman McCall

title: Madres Contra la Guerra Contact with the FBI

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that US officials have insinuated that the FBI investigate Pro-Palestine groups: https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-news/pelosi-fbi-pro-palestine-protesters-russia-1234955648/

Tweets show members of Puerto Rican Pro-Palestine group "Madres Contra la Guerra" believe they have been visited, surveilled, and/or interviewed by the FBI: https://x.com/ManuelEMelende5/status/1769780724209455420?s=20  

The purpose of this request is to obtain information for the public on FBI surveillance of Madres Contra la Guerra, surveillance of the aforementioned group, decisions on surveillance, and the impact it has on anti-war groups. This information will enable the public to engage in an important ongoing policy debate and the upcoming Congressional appropriations debate.

In this request, ‘records’ includes, but is not limited to, all records or communications preserved in electronic or written form, such as correspondences, emails, documents, data, videotapes, audio tapes, faxes, files, guidances, guidelines, analyses, memoranda, agreements, notes, orders, policies, procedures, legal opinions, protocols, reports, rules, or manuals.

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any communications, messages, emails, and attachments exchanged within the FBI concerning "Madres Contra la Guerra" or their spokesperson Sonia Santiago Hernández.  

2) Any communications, messages, emails, and attachments exchanged between the FBI and other law enforcement agencies (including but not limited to the Puerto Rico Police Department and the Department of Homeland Security) concerning "Madres Contra la Guerra" or their spokesperson Sonia Santiago Hernández.  

3) Any after action reports and executive summaries after surveillance of or contact with "Madres Contra la Guerra" or their spokesperson Sonia Santiago Hernández.  Please include any notes taken before, during, or after contact or surveillance with the aforementioned group or subject.

4) Any presentations, videos, audios, transcripts, and attachments used to educate FBI personnel or personnel from any other law enforcement agency about "Madres Contra la Guerra" or their spokesperson Sonia Santiago Hernández.

Please do a search of main file records alongside cross-reference records and an ELSUR (electronic surveillance) records. Additionally, please search the Sentinel database, the Investigative Data Warehouse, and the Data Integration and Visualization System.

This request is for all records produced between Jan 1, 2024 and the time this request is processed. In the event there are multiple records, please send them to me on a rolling basis.

I ask that this request be given expedited processing and be placed on the simple track given the relative simplicity of the request and the short time span in which the requested records would have been produced.

This request is not being done for commercial purposes and will be made available to the general public. The records released by this request are likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the governmentI am an independent journalist and any responsive records will be used in the course of reporting about Pro-Palestine protests in Puerto Rico.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records of the US Park Police in relation to Northern District of California case 3:23-cr-00439-JD, specifically the April 4, 2023 incident involving a collision between a car driven by Arnold Kinman Low and cyclist Ethan Boyes in the Presidio of San Francisco.
